page.title: 16Aspects of Lyddington
page.content: There is no school in Lyddington,at 5 years children go to school by bus to Uppingham,some to private schools in the area.The old school building is now the village hall and is used by a preschool playgroup 5 mornings a week. There is a committee which run the village hall.The old Reading Room which was owned by the village was sold recently to finance a playing field,this seemed to cause some ill feeling between the old and new vill- agers.A bus service operates twice a week to Corby and most shopping is done there or Uppingham.A Mobile Library calls once a month.There are 2 Building firms and an Electrician and apart from the farms no employment for young people.There is no provision for elderly people when they become infirm so they are accommodated in nearby towns.
